byline.contributor: Jeffrey Moyo reported from Harare, and Norimitsu Onishi from Johannesburg.
byline.original: By JEFFREY MOYO and NORIMITSU ONISHI

abstract: Zimbabwean Vice Pres Phelekezela Mphoko is said to be preparing to finally leave presidential suite at Rainbow Towers hotel in Harare, where he has lived at cost to taxpayers of $1,000 per night since December 2014; Mphoko's stay at hotel has sparked protests and caused headache for embattled Pres Robert Mugabe at time when police and army are not being paid on time.

headline.print_headline: Protesters Fume as Vice President in Zimbabwe Runs Up a Hotel Bill
headline.main: Protesters Fume as Zimbabwe Vice President Runs Up a Hotel Bill

snippet: Vice President Phelekezela Mphoko’s year-and-a-half stay in a luxurious hotel — at a taxpayer cost of $1,000 a night, including meals — may be coming to an end....
lead_paragraph: Vice President Phelekezela Mphoko’s year-and-a-half stay in a luxurious hotel — at a taxpayer cost of $1,000 a night, including meals — may be coming to an end.
